page.title: 04FORESTRY IN LOCHALSH
page.content: People visit the forest as they like to get away from motor cars and have some peace.But they do not just like to see conifers.They like to see broad leaved trees.The Forestry Commission is planting a lot more broad leaved trees now than it previously did.This is to encourage people to visit and increase the conservation value.Broad leaved trees bring more wildlife and people like to see them.People like to walk in the forest but they need to have identified walks.There are no such walks in Ratagan except at Dorusduain.There is a need for marked tracks and boards on which there would be information about the area.It would also be important to grow the trees far bigger than at present as people like to see big trees.
